Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the role of unproven voter fraud claims in the Capitol riot, as there is evidence that some individuals believed in the election being rigged and unfairly stolen from President Trump.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that unproven voter fraud claims didn't play any role in the Capitol riot.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that unproven voter fraud claims had no influence on the actions of the pro-Trump mob, which may be a problematic assumption considering the beliefs and rhetoric surrounding the election.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that suggests the belief in voter fraud claims played a role in motivating the pro-Trump mob to storm the Capitol.
